trans-unit.source: Titel of the crossword puzzle
Titel of the crossword puzzle only for internal description. This title doesn't apears on the frontend.
Width of the crossword puzzle
Number of fields in width
If the crossword should contain 10 fields in width, then write 10 in this field.
Height of the crossword puzzle
Number of fields in height
If the crossword should contain 10 fields in height, then write 10 in this field.
Relatet questions of the crossword puzzle
All questions which are relatet to this crossword. Click hier for full description.

You have to create in a sysFolder all questions for this crossword. Go in the list view to a sysFolder and create a new item of the type question. Then you can assign this question to this field of the crossword.
Factor to scale the width of the crossword
Write 2 to double the width or 0.5 to shrink to half.
Factor to scale the height of the crossword
Write 2 to double the height or 0.5 to shrink to half.
Border width of the crossword boxes in pixel
Alternative CSS file with individual layout configuration for the crossword. Look at the long description.
Click here to see the long text.

If you like to create your own layout for the crossword, then copy the file glcrossword.css from the folder /typo3conf/ext/glcrossword/css/ in any place under /fileadmin/ and customize it for your own needs. Never alter the name of the classes. Only the content of the classes is allowed for changings. Then describe the path to this file from the fileadmin-folder in this field. For instance if you have place your own css file in the folder /fileadmin/myHomepage/myowncrossword.css then you have to write myHomepage/myowncrossword.css into this field. If you leave it empty, then this plugin use the default css file. Should you try to set more then one crossword on one page, then you need to place in every crossword the same alternate CSS file. Otherwise would win alway the css file of the last crossword.
Include css file for dark color scheme, if you like to support "color-scheme: dark" of the browser.

Modern Browsers support the meta tag 'meta name="color-scheme" content="light dark"' With that settings you can support two different color schemes in one page. If you like to support dark and light color schemes, you should activate this option.
